alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Knott; Magoffin; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 11:43PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Martin, southeastern Johnson, northeastern Knott, Floyd, northwestern Pike and southeastern Magoffin Counties through 1215 AM EST... At 1142 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wells to Bolyn. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wells, Milo, Add, Stidham, Tomahawk, Chestnut, Pevier, Debord, Davisport and Whitehouse around 1145 PM EST. Inez, Calf Creek, Job, Bradbury and Preece around 1150 PM EST. Warfield, Hode, Beauty, Andy, Lovely and Printer around 1155 PM EST. Craynor, Beaver, Buckhorn Hollow, Grethel, Blue Moon, Honaker, Aluba, Oppy and Pilgrim around 1200 AM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Galveston, Osborn, Boldman, Harold, Pikeville, Coal Run Village, Coal Run, Chloe, Shelbiana, Garden Village, Raccoon and Zebulon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Floyd; Johnson; Knott; Magoffin; Martin; Pike
